headline: Brownie Cookie Whoopie Pies
description: Soft, chewy cookies with rich, chocolate brownie flavor are filled with a sweet, creamy, marshmallow filling in this tasty whoopie pie recipe using brownie mix.
name: Brownie Cookie Whoopie Pies
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon multicolored candy sprinkles, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Lightly coat a wire rack with cooking spray.
Stir brownie mix and flour together in a medium bowl until well combined. Add chocolate chips, oil, and eggs; stir until well blended.
Scoop 20 rounded tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheets. Decorate 1/2 of the cookies with candy sprinkles.
Bake in the preheated oven for 9 to 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and let stand for 2 to 3 minutes before removing to the sprayed rack to cool completely, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine powdered sugar, butter, and vanilla in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; blend until light and fluffy, about 4 minutes. Fold in marshmallow creme.

Place marshmallow mixture in a large zip-top bag and cut a small hole in one corner. Pipe filling onto the center of one plain cookie and top with a sprinkled cookie. Repeat with remaining filling and cookies.

review.reviewBody: I added 1/4 cup more veggie oil. Came out moist & yummy! DO NOT overmix. Watch your measurements. So important.

When the dough was so thick that I had to use my hands to mix it, I should have known this wouldn't be great. It was so thick that the outside is overly done and the center is still raw. Also, the math is a mess. Each half is only ONE tablespoon ? This is roughly a total of 58 ounces so I'm trying to figure out how this would only make 20 teeny tiny cookies? Searching for a better recipe.
